duck: Sentence - A sentence is a grammatical unit consisting of one or more words that bear minimal syntactic relation to the words that precede or follow it.
Pragmatics - Pragmatics is a subfield of linguistics which studies the ways in which context contributes to meaning.
Phonological hierarchy - Phonological hierarchy describes a series of increasingly smaller regions of a phonological utterance.
Speech processing - Speech processing is the study of speech signals and the processing methods of these signals.
Speech act - Speech act is a technical term in linguistics and the philosophy of language.
Uttering - In the law of countries whose legal systems derive from English common law, uttering is a crime similar to forgery.
In spoken language analysis an utterance is a smallest unit of speech.

milestones: Shiv Sena activists disrupt news conference in Jammu

wiki.text:
In spoken language analysis an 'utterance' is a smallest unit of speech. In the
case of oral languages, it is generally but not always bounded by silence. It
can be represented and delineated in written language in many ways. Note that in
such areas of research utterances do not exist in written language, only their
representations do. In other fields it is medium-neutral and refers to any use
of language in context (in contrast with the abstract form sentence).

Uttering can also be a form of stuttering especially in the case of handicapped
people. The word was coined on May 12, 1986 at the World Speech Convention .
wiki.title: utterance
